content.description:
A long and varied route up a somewhat hidden face behind a large pine tree.

Like many of the other routes at Amazonia, begin the route with a thrutchy and cruxy roof move to surprise incuts.  Establish your feet over the roof, and enjoy the technical, yet not physically demanding, face climbing to the anchors.

There are several opportunities to gain rests.  And be careful of the raptor ledge about midway up the route--you wouldn't want to get caught climbing into the nest by mamma bird.
content.location: On the far left end of the wall.  This is the second route from the left that starts behind the large, lone pine tree.

content.description: Climb the begining of Q.D. Pie and vear left when you get ontop of the bulge about halfway up, the crux it at the very top of the climb. a little too short for my liking.
content.location: the second to last route on the right side

content.description: it's a little runout to the first bolt but on moderate climbing. the crux comes about the large flake.
content.protection: 5 bolts plus 2 for the chains. rap or lower frome the chains
content.location: 4 routes from the end, climbs up a large flake to the first bolt

content.description: A thin start with tricky feet (if climbing directly through the bolt line) brings you to easier moves on good holds for the rest of the climb and a mossy section at the top.
content.location: To the right of I Remember Drooling and to the left of Sodflesh

content.description: Fun climbing on big holds with a couple of very moderate pulls over bulges
content.location: In the middle of the wall, just right of 'Drier Adhesive..." and left of 'I Remember Drooling'

content.description: Very short route and shared start with Ten-ish Ooze.  Move right for the last bolt and meet at the same anchor.
content.location: Shared start with Ten-ish Ooze; move right at the last bolt

content.description: climb to the roof and pull the lip using an awsome heel hook, then after that  the crux is just fighting the pump near the upper section of the wall. you will see a bolt a little more than halfway up the wall that has been used as a bail biner, this is where the pump really starts to get ya.
content.protection: 6 draw plus 2 for the chains. rap or lower frim the chains
content.location: three routes to the left of the wet spot.

content.description: First line of bolts to the right of the wet area.  Usually a wet route, but very fun when dry.
content.location: First line of bolts to the right of the wet area.

content.description:
often wet.

nice overhanging block at top.
content.location: left route of central waterfall, right of Iguanarama.

content.description: the crux comes while getting to the second bolt. then climb the awsome jugs to the top.
content.protection: 7 draws plus 2 for the chains. rap or lower from the chains
content.location: two routes to the left of the wet spot

content.description: Very similar to Radioactive Decay.  Roof/bulge pulls on big holds and lots of fun.
content.location: In the middle of the wall, just right of Radioactive Decay
right of the 5.9 Sodflesh, and left of Ten-ish ooze.

content.description: Tricky, insecure moves with ground fall potential. When clean, it can be fun.

climbs.name: Drier Adhesive to the Corporeal Abyss

content.description: First off, this route would have another star if it were cleaned. anyways the crux is definately after the first bolt. which is scetchy because you could easily deck on the ledge if you blow the crux. a little bit of technical climbing, back-steps and the sort. at about halfway the route gets pretty soft and the bolts spread out
content.protection: 4 bolts and 2 for the chains. rap or lower from the chains.
content.location: two routes to the right of the wet spot.

content.description: Vertical to gently overhanging. Large jugs and fun climbing lead you through the canopy of the tree and to a short roof section. Climb through the roof to the chains. Watch out for the tree branches on the rappel.
content.location: The farthest left route at Amazonia. Look for the tree growing right next to the wall.
